p: EDTA can improve the sensitivity of Gram-positive bacteria and Gram-negative bacteria to lysozyme [ 70, 101]. Del Nobile et al. [ 103] studied the antimicrobial effect of nisin and lysozyme combined with EDTA on spoilage microorganisms in chilled buffalo meat. The best effect is achieved by combining 0.5% lysozyme and 2% EDTA, which can inhibit the growth of all investigated bacteria, including Brochotrix thermosphacta. These studies have confirmed that incorporating EDTA into some antimicrobial agents can enhance their inhibitory effects on spoilage bacteria.
